flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.StarfieldFX

type
class
extends
BaseFX
Creates a 2D or 3D Star Field effect on an FlxSprite for use in your game. //todo Neko target is unsupported, possible issue with tilesize

Static Variables

STARFIELD_TYPE_2D(inline,null) : Int

STARFIELD_TYPE_3D(inline,null) : Int

Constructor

new()

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

active : Bool

inherited from flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.BaseFX
Set to false to stop this effect being updated by the FlxSpecialFX Plugin. Set to true to enable.

back : flash.display.BitmapData

inherited from flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.BaseFX
TODO A snapshot of the sprite background before the effect is applied

canvas : flash.display.BitmapData

inherited from flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.BaseFX
A scratch bitmapData used to build-up the effect before passing to sprite.pixels

centerX : Int

In a 3D starfield this controls the X coordinate the stars emit from, can be updated in real-time!

centerY : Int

In a 3D starfield this controls the Y coordinate the stars emit from, can be updated in real-time!

speed(accessor,accessor) : Int

sprite : flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.BaseFX
The FlxSprite into which the effect is drawn. Add this to your FlxState / FlxGroup to display the effect.

starXOffset : Float

How much to shift on the X axis every update. Negative values move towards the left, positiive to the right. 2D Starfield only. Can also be set via setStarSpeed()

starYOffset : Float

How much to shift on the Y axis every update. Negative values move up, positiive values move down. 2D Starfield only. Can also be set via setStarSpeed()

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

create(X : Int, Y : Int, Width : Int, Height : Int, ?Quantity : Int, ?FieldType : Int, ?UpdateInterval : Int) : flixel.FlxSprite

parameters
X X coordinate of the starfield sprite
Y Y coordinate of the starfield sprite
Width The width of the starfield
Height The height of the starfield
Quantity The number of stars in the starfield (default 200)
FieldType Type of starfield. Either STARFIELD_TYPE_2D (default, stars move horizontally) or STARFIELD_TYPE_3D (stars flow out from the center)
UpdateInterval How many ms should pass before the next starfield update (default 20)
Create a new StarField

destroy() : Void

inherited from flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.BaseFX

draw() : Void

overrides flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.BaseFX

setBackgroundColor(BackgroundColor : Int) : Void

Change the background color in the format 0xAARRGGBB of the starfield. Supports alpha, so if you want a transparent background just pass 0x00 as the color.

setStarDepthColors(Depth : Int, ?LowestColor : Int, ?HighestColor : Int) : Void

parameters
Depth Number of depths (for a 2D starfield the default is 5)
LowestColor The color given to the stars furthest away from the camera (i.e. the slowest stars), typically the darker colour
HighestColor The color given to the stars cloest to the camera (i.e. the fastest stars), typically the brighter colour
Change the number of layers (depth) and colors used for each layer of the starfield. Change happens immediately.

setStarSpeed(ShiftX : Float, ShiftY : Float) : Void

parameters
ShiftX How much to shift on the X axis every update. Negative values move towards the left, positiive to the right
ShiftY How much to shift on the Y axis every update. Negative values move up, positiive values move down
Sets the direction and speed of the 2D starfield (doesn't apply to 3D) You can combine both X and Y together to make the stars move on a diagnol

start(?Delay : Int) : Void

inherited from flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.BaseFX
parameters
Delay How many "game updates" should pass between each update? If your game runs at 30fps a value of 0 means it will do 30 updates per second. A value of 1 means it will do 15 updates per second, etc.
Starts the effect runnning

stop() : Void

inherited from flixel.addons.plugin.effects.fx.BaseFX
Pauses the effect from running. The draw function is still called each loop, but the pixel data is stopped from updating.
To disable the SpecialFX Plugin from calling the FX at all set the "active" parameter to false.
